Information.p: Values are mixed and the terms "Mixed" and "Other" are derived from E-ARK

Entry.Definition: Books, musical compositions, etc.
Electronic books, etc.
A journal, etc.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Addition of description
This value is from an old version of the LoC list

Entry.Definition: A printed version of a musical score

Entry.Definition: A print in the form of a roll microfilm

Entry.Term: Audio – On Tangible Medium (digital or analog)
Entry.Definition: Audio on a media
Entry.RevisionInformation: Addition of description

Entry.Definition: A digital audio version
Entry.RevisionInformation: Addition of description

Entry.Term: Motion Pictures – Digital and Physical Media
Entry.Definition: Theatrically released films
Final production version with the original production resolution and frame rate (i.e. 1080p24; 720p60, etc.) and file-based format that was delivered to the content distributor
Entry.RevisionInformation: Addition of description

Entry.Definition: Software, electronic gaming and learning

This category includes software and games for desktop and mobile/handheld systems and video gaming consoles. Note: Games for gaming consoles often require submission of the proprietary platform as well (e.g., game console) or a virtual or emulated version of the proprietary platform that runs on a commonly available operating system.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from the LoC value list

Entry.Definition: Email
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from the LoC value list

Entry.Definition: Data encoded in a defined structure.
Entry.Source: Dublin Core value list and LoC value list

Entry.RevisionInformation: This value is from an old version of the LoC list

Entry.Definition: Most complete data (all layers, appendices), even if proprietary, with a preference for preserving the native format and projection of the data
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from the LoC value list

Entry.Definition: GIS in raster form
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from the LoC value list

Entry.Definition: GIS in a combination of vector and raster form

Entry.Definition: Maps and other cartographic materials produced outside of Geographic Information Systems, or which have been published and disseminated primarily as image or textual works.

Entry.Definition: An aggregation of resources.
A non-persistent, time-based occurrence, e.g. exhibition, webcast, etc..
A visual representation other than text.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from DublinCore value list

Entry.Definition: A resource requiring interaction from the user to be understood, executed, or experienced.
A series of visual representations imparting an impression of motion when shown in succession.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from DublinCore value list

Entry.Definition: A resource primarily intended to be heard.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from DublinCore value list

Entry.Definition: A static visual representation.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from DublinCore value list

Entry.Definition: A resource consisting primarily of words for reading.
Entry.RevisionInformation: Value added from DublinCore value list

Entry.Definition: An inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance.
A system that provides one or more functions.
The package contains a mix of content types
A term other than present in the vocabulary is used
